info.title: CIC Implementation of PSD2 ASPSP services (based on STET Specification).
info.description:
This API specification describes the implementation of STET API Standards
by CIC, based on the API Specifications published by STET at
[https://www.stet.eu/en/psd2/](https://www.stet.eu/en/psd2/).

The reader of this specification is assumed to already be familiar with the
concepts and general workflows of the public STET API Specification. For
example, acronyms from PSD2 (TPP, AISP, etc.) and the public STET
Specification will be used without further elaboration.

The API description here is based on the 1.4.2 version of the STET PSD2 API.

General developer documentation about the APIs, registration, etc. can be
found on the [Developer Portal].

The sandbox APIs, for use when qualifying the workflows and APIs,
can be found at `https://oauth2-apiii.e-i.com/sandbox/cic/stet-psd2-api/v2.0/`.

The production APIs can be found at `https://oauth2-apiii.e-i.com/cic/stet-psd2-api/v2.0/`.

Changes from PSD2 ASPSP API 1.1:

  * In the `PaymentRequestResource` schema, the field that describes the payment request
    status is now correctly named `paymentInformationStatus`;
  * In the `CreditTransferTransaction` schema, the fields `transactionStatus`
    and `statusReasonInformation` are now available;
  * Payment cancellation workflows are now initiated with status `CANC`
    and do not require SCA;
  * The API endpoints now conform to STET Specification v1.4.2;
  * The REDIRECT workflow for payment confirmation now conforms to OAuth2
    authorization code flow;

[Developer Portal]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/
[open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html

get.description:
### Description
This call returns all payment accounts linked to the PSU.

### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as an AISP;
 * The TPP must have obtained the PSU's authorization for API Access, with an [SCA][sca-workflows];
 * The TPP must access the API using an [Authorization Code][oauth2-endpoints] access token derived from the PSU's authorization;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api].

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html

200.description:
The ASPSP return a PSU context
- listing the accounts that have been made available to the AISP by the PSU and,
- for each of these accounts, the further transactions that have been enabled by the PSU through HYPERMEDIA links.

get.description:
### Description
This call returns all available balances for one of the PSU's accounts.

### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as an AISP;
 * The TPP must have obtained the PSU's authorization for API Access, with an [SCA][sca-workflows];
 * The TPP must access the API using an [Authorization Code][oauth2-endpoints] access token derived from the PSU's authorization;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api].

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html
get.summary: Retrieval of an account balances report (AISP)

200.description: The ASPSP answers with a list of account balances

get.description:
### Description
This call returns transaction information for one of the PSU's accounts.

Returned results may be paginated.

### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as an AISP;
 * The TPP must have obtained the PSU's authorization for API Access, with an [SCA][sca-workflows];
 * The TPP must access the API using an [Authorization Code][oauth2-endpoints] access token derived from the PSU's authorization;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api].

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html
get.summary: Retrieval of an account transaction set (AISP)
Retrieval of the identity of the end-user (AISP)
get.description:
### Description
This call returns the PSU's identity (first and last name).

### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as an AISP;
 * The TPP must have obtained the PSU's authorization for API Access, with an [SCA][sca-workflows];
 * The TPP must access the API using an [Authorization Code][oauth2-endpoints] access token derived from the PSU's authorization;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api].

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html

200.description: The ASPSP returns the identity of the PSU

get.summary: Retrieval of the trusted beneficiaries list (AISP)
get.description:
### Description
This call returns beneficiaries that are trusted by the PSU - meaning
that a payment request, the beneficiary of which is trusted, may, in
some cases, be exempt from SCA.

Returned results may be paginated.

### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as an AISP;
 * The TPP must have obtained the PSU's authorization for API Access, with an [SCA][sca-workflows];
 * The TPP must access the API using an [Authorization Code][oauth2-endpoints] access token derived from the PSU's authorization;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api].

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html

200.description: The ASPSP returns the list of whitelisted beneficiaries

post.description:
### Description
This call returns whether a payment with the given characteristics (account, payee, amount) may be covered.
### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as a CBPII;
 * The TPP must have obtained the PSU's authorization for API Access, with an [SCA][sca-workflows];
 * The TPP must access the API using an [Authorization Code][oauth2-endpoints] access token derived from the PSU's authorization;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api].

### Implementation notes
While STET specifies that an OAuth 2 [Client Credentials][oauth2-endpoints] grant may be used by a CBPII to access that information, that workflow is not currently supported for CBPIIs, as there is currently no way for a CBPII and a PSU to establish a contract outside of an OAuth 2 Authorization Code workflow.

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html

requestBody.description: parameters of a payment coverage request

post.description:
### Description

Initiate payment from an account serviced by CIC.

The payment account can be specified by its <abbr>IBAN</abbr>.
If left unspecified, an SCA will be necessary for the PSU to specify
the source account.

The account owning PSU can be hinted by a TPP who has both AISP and
PISP roles with an OAuth 2 authorization code token in `debtor`. If left
unspecified, an SCA will be necessary.

The payment can specify:
  * A single execution date with a single beneficiary;
  * A single execution date with multiple beneficiaries;
  * A standing order with a single beneficiary;

The only supported payment instrument are SEPA Credit Transfers.
In some cases, SEPA Instant Credit Transfers may be supported.

### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as a PISP;
 * The TPP must access the API using a [Client Credentials][oauth2-endpoints] access token;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api];

### SCA Workflows and validation

The only SCA Workflow supported by this API is the REDIRECT workflow.
That workflow is described on the [SCA Workflows][sca-workflows] page
on the Developer Portal.

### Handling of trusted beneficiaries

In the case of a payment request or a standing order with a single
beneficiary, the target beneficiary may be in the PSU's list of trusted
beneficiaries.

If the beneficiary is not on the list of trusted beneficiaries, an SCA
will always be performed during the authentication workflow, as on the
interfaces provided by CIC. The PSD2 API provided by CIC
does not allow adding entries to the list of trusted beneficiaries.

If the beneficiary is trusted, an SCA exemption may be applied. In order
to fully benefit from such an exemption, the flag `isTrusted` must be set
by the PISP to `true`. In case the PISP sets a value for that flag that
does not match the beneficiary's trust status for that PSU, an additional
SCA may be asked of the user during the SCA workflow.

In the case of a payment initiation request with multiple beneficiaries,
the payment will succeed only for beneficiaries that are on the PSU's
list of trusted beneficiaries, matching the behavior of that feature on
the interfaces provided by CIC.

### Beneficiary account identification

| Payment type | Beneficiary account identification method |
|--------------|-------------------------------------------|
| SEPA payment | IBAN is required, BIC is optional. If the provided BIC does not match the IBAN, the API will return a 400 HTTP status code. |
| Cross-border payment with IBAN | IBAN and BIC are required.  |
| Cross-border payment without IBAN, with BIC | A `BANK` scheme account identifier and BIC are required. |
| Cross-border payment without IBAN or BIC | A `BANK` scheme account identifier, and the bank name and postal address, are required. |        | Payment type | Beneficiary account identification method |

The beneficiary information provided in the request will be automatically matched with the
list of trusted beneficiaries to check whether to apply SCA to the payment redirection process.

The data taken in account by that matching depends on whether it is a SEPA or cross-border payment.

| Payment type | Fields used for matching with a trusted beneficiary |
|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| SEPA payment | IBAN. Bank name and address, beneficiary name and address, will be not be processed. |
| Cross-border payment outside SEPA | Account identifier (IBAN or `BANK` scheme), BIC, bank name and address, beneficiary name and address. |


  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html


### Transmission of Remittance Information from POST /payment-requests in GET /accounts/{accountId}/transactions

In the case of CIC, only the 22 first characters set in the unstructured remittance information
set in the payment initiation request are guaranteed to be visible when retrieving the corresponding transaction in
GET `/accounts/{accountId}/transactions`.

201.description: The request has been created as a resource. The ASPSP must authenticate the PSU.

location.description:
URI of the created (and updated if needed) Payment Request.
Actually, this link is the URI to be used (cf. ยง 4.6) for retrieving the Payment Request ant its status:
  - GET /payment-requests/{paymentRequestResourceId}
The parameter {paymentRequestResourceId} is the identifier of the Payment Request, as the resource that was created on the ASPSP server side.

200.description: Retrieval of the previously posted Payment Request

put.description:
### Description

Cancel a payment request previously created through the API.

As implemented by CIC, the only supported cancellation
operation is a cancellation of all extant credit operations. (Also
called "full cancellation").

In order to request a full cancellation, the request body must meet the following requirements :
  * `$.paymentInformationStatus` must be set to value `CANC`;
  * `$.statusReasonInformation` must be set to one of the values listed below;
  * All other fields must match the original accepted request;

Possible values for the `statusReasonInformation` field are:
| Reason | description |
| ------ | ----------- |
| DS02 | The PSU ordered the cancellation. |
| DUPL | The PISP requests the cancellation for a duplication of a previous Payment/Transfer request |
| FRAD | The PISP requests the cancellation for fraudulent origin of the Payment/Transfer request |
| TECH | The PISP requests the cancellation for a technical issue on its side |

In cases where a request field is not correct, a 400 error will be returned.
In cases where the cancellation cannot be effected (e.g. because the credit
transfer has already been effected), a 409 Conflict status code will be returned.

In order for the cancellation to be effective, a call to the
`/confirmation` endpoint is required, with the nonce returned by this
endpoint.

### Prerequisites

 * The TPP must be [registered][registration] as a PISP;
 * The TPP must access the API using a [Client Credentials][oauth2-endpoints] access token;
 * The TPP must have previously created the payment, using an access token associated with the same OAuth Client ID;
 * The TPP must send the request respecting the requirements for using the CIC [Open Banking API][open-banking-api];

### SCA Workflows and validation

No SCA is required to cancel a payment - the only supported workflow
here is `NONE`.

However, in order for the cancellation to be effective, a call to the
`/confirmation` endpoint is required, with the nonce returned by this
endpoint.

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html
  [sca-workflows]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/sca-workflows.html

200.description: The modification request has been saved. The ASPSP must authenticate the PSU before committing the update.

post.summary: Confirmation of a payment cancellation request (PISP)

200.description: retrieval of the Payment Request enriched with the status report

requestBody.description: Parameters needed for confirmation of the Payment Request.

post.summary: Confirmation of a payment request using OAuth 2 authorization code grant.

200.description: retrieval of the Payment Request enriched with the status report

requestBody.description: Parameters needed for confirmation of the Payment Request.

Correlation.description: Correlation header to be set in a request and retrieved in the relevant response

Signature.description:
http-signature of the response (cf.
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-cavage-http-signatures/)

The `keyId` field is set to a URL from which a PEM of the
signing certificate can be retrieved. CIC guarantees
that the URL will change if and when a different signing key is used.

AccountResourceIdentification.name: accountResourceId
AccountResourceIdentification.description: Identification of account resource to fetch

PaymentRequestResourceIdentification.name: paymentRequestResourceId
PaymentRequestResourceIdentification.description: Identification of the Payment Request Resource

ToImputationDate.name: dateTo
ToImputationDate.description:
Exclusive maximal imputation date of the transactions.
Transactions having an imputation date equal to this parameter are not included within the result.

FromImputationDate.name: dateFrom
FromImputationDate.description:
Inclusive minimal imputation date of the transactions.
Transactions having an imputation date equal to this parameter are included within the result.

UiLocales.name: ui_locales
UiLocales.description: End-User's preferred languages and scripts for the user interface, represented as a space-separated list of BCP47 [RFC5646] language tag values, ordered by preference.

AuthorizationParameter.name: Authorization
AuthorizationParameter.description: Access token to be passed as a header

AcceptHeader.name: Accept
AcceptHeader.description:
A description of a list of content-types that the client would like to receive.
Defined by [RFC 7231, ยง5.3.2](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.3.2)
Depending on the endpoint, the value of this header may be taken in account for content negotiation, or may be ignored.

AcceptLanguageHeader.name: Accept-Language
AcceptLanguageHeader.description: A specification of the language in which to return content. Conforms to [RFC 7231, ยง5.3.5](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.3.5). If unspecified, or if none of the given languages can be satisfied, the content will be returned in one of the available languages.

UserAgentHeader.name: User-Agent
UserAgentHeader.description:
Information about the user agent originating the request.
Documented in [RFC 7231, ยง5.5.3](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.5.3)

PsuIpAddressHeader.name: PSU-IP-Address
PsuIpAddressHeader.description: IP address used by the PSU's terminal when connecting to the TPP

PsuIpPortHeader.name: PSU-IP-Port
PsuIpPortHeader.description: IP port used by the PSU's terminal when connecting to the TPP

PsuHttpMethodHeader.name: PSU-HTTP-Method
PsuHttpMethodHeader.description: Http method for the most relevant PSUโs terminal request to the TTP

PsuDateHeader.name: PSU-Date
PsuDateHeader.description: Timestamp of the most relevant PSUโs terminal request to the TTP

PsuGeoLocation.name: PSU-GEO-Location
PsuGeoLocation.description: Geographical location of the PSU as provided by the PSU mobile terminal if any to the TPP

PsuUserAgentHeader.name: PSU-User-Agent
PsuUserAgentHeader.description: "User-Agent" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

PsuRefererHeader.name: PSU-Referer
PsuRefererHeader.description:
"Referer" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP.
Notice that an initial typo in RFC 1945 specifies that "referer" (incorrect spelling) is to be used. The correct spelling "referrer" can be used but might not be understood.

PsuAcceptHeader.name: PSU-Accept
PsuAcceptHeader.description: "Accept" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

PsuAcceptCharsetHeader.name: PSU-Accept-Charset
PsuAcceptCharsetHeader.description: "Accept-Charset" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

PsuAcceptEncodingHeader.name: PSU-Accept-Encoding
PsuAcceptEncodingHeader.description: "Accept-Encoding" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

PsuAcceptLanguageHeader.name: PSU-Accept-Language
PsuAcceptLanguageHeader.description: "Accept-Language" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

PsuDeviceId.name: PSU-Device-ID
PsuDeviceId.description:
UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available.
UUID identifies either a device or a device dependant application installation.
In case of installation identification this ID need to be unaltered until removal from device.

SignatureHeader.name: Signature
SignatureHeader.description:
http-signature of the request (cf.
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-cavage-http-signatures/)

The `keyId` must reference one of the JWKs referencing a sealing certificate
associated with the OAuth2 client registration for which the access
token was issued.

It can be set to either:
  * The `kid` value set by CIC;
  * The `x5u` value sent by the TPP;

More details about Signature of HTTP Requests can be found on the
Developer Portal:
  * The [TPP Registration page][registration] contains details about
    the registration procedure, and which certificates to use for
    signing in the PSD2 context;
  * The [OAuth 2 API page][oauth2-endpoints] contains details about the
    precise format in which to send the Qualified Certificates;
  * The [Open Banking API page][open-banking-api] contains details
    about which headers to sign, and how to successfully sign requests;

  [registration]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/registration.html
  [oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
  [open-banking-api]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/open-banking-api.html

Correlation.name: X-Request-ID
Correlation.description: Correlation header to be set in a request and retrieved in the relevant response

403.description: Forbidden, authentication successful but access to resource is not allowed.

409.description:
Conflict.
The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource.

501.description:
Not Implemented.
This code should be used when the entry point is implemented but cannot provide a result, given the context.
When the entry point is not implemented at all, HTTP400 will be returned.

accessCode.description:
In order to access the PSU's account information, the AISP needs to get an authorization code grant OAUTH2 token.
The `client_id` field within the token request must be filled with the value of the client ID obtained after registration on the OAuth 2 [client registration endpoints][oauth2-endpoints].
[oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html
The following Authorization URLs are available:
  * `https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/{lang}/sandbox/signin.html` is the URL with which
    TPPs can test the authorization code and SCA workflows for `aisp`
    and `cbpii` scopes in the Sandbox environment;
  * `https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/{lang}/banque/oauth2_authorization.aspx` is the
    URL with which PSUs of CIC can authorize an AISP or CBPII
    TPP for access to their payment banking accounts;
  * The `{lang}` tag can be replaced by one of the following values:
    ["de","en","es","fr"]

For PISP workflows, (`pisp` scope), the OAuth 2 authorization URL is given in the HTTP response to the initial POST, in the body at JSON path `$._links.consentApproval`. Some of the OAuth 2 authorization requests parameters will already have been filled in the provided URL.

scopes.aisp: Access by an AISP to one given PSU's account
scopes.cbpii: Access by a CBPII to one given PSU's account to check payment coverage
scopes.pisp: Access by a PISP to confirm a payment with the OAuth 2 redirect workflow.
scopes.extended_transaction_history: Access by an AISP to a transaction history over more than the 90 last days

clientCredentials.description:
In order to post a Payment or Transfer Request, the PISP needs to get an client credential OAUTH2 token.
The `client_id` field within the token request must be filled with the value of the client ID obtained after registration on the OAuth 2 [client registration endpoints][oauth2-endpoints].
[oauth2-endpoints]: https://www.cic.fr/oauth2/en/devportal/oauth2-endpoints.html

scopes.pisp: Access by a PISP to payments resources

errors.description: A list of detailed error messages on content that was posted.

items.description: A detailed error pointing to a specific error in the request.

path.description: A string representation of the source of the error. In case the error was found in the request's JSON content, this value will be expressed as a JSON Path.

message.description: A human-readable message describing why the request was invalid at the referenced path.

example.message: Missing request header 'Digest' for method parameter of type String

templated.description: specifies "true" if href is a URI template, i.e. with parameters. Otherwise, this property is absent or set to false

AccountsPageLinks.description:
Links that can be used for further navigation when browsing Account Information at top level
- self: link to the list of all available accounts

AccountLinks.description:
links that can be used for further navigation when browsing Account Information at one account level

| Link | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| balances | link to the balances of a given account |
| transactions | link to the transactions of a given account |

BalancesLinks.description:
links that can be used for further navigation when browsing Account Information at one account level

| Link | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| self | link to the balances of a given account |
| parent-list | link to the list of all available accounts |
| transactions | link to the transactions of a given account |

TransactionsLinks.description:
links that can be used for further navigation when browsing Account Information at one account level

| Link | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| self | link to the transactions of a given account |
| parent-list | link to the list of all available accounts |
| balances | link to the balances of a given account |
| first | link to the first page of the transactions result |
| last | link to the last page of the transactions result |
| next | link to the next page of the transactions result |
| prev | link to the previous page of the transactions result |

EndUserIdentityLinks.description:
links that can be used for further navigation when browsing Account Information at one account level

| Link | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| self | link to the end-user identity |
| parent-list | link to the list of all available accounts |

BeneficiariesLinks.description:
links that can be used for further navigation when browsing Account Information at one account level

| Link | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| self | link to the beneficiaries |
| parent-list | link to the list of all available accounts |
| first | link to the first page of the beneficiaries result |
| last | link to the last page of the beneficiaries result |
| next | link to the next page of the beneficiaries result |
| prev | link to the previous page of the beneficiaries result |

PaymentRequestLinks.description: links that can be used for further navigation when having post a Payment Request in order to get the relevant status report.

request.description: This link provides the payment-request URL for retrieving or modifying

confirmation.description: This link shall not be provided when the confirmation was already posted.

PaymentCoverageReportLinks.description: links that can be used for further navigation to post another coverage request.

PaymentRequestResourceCreationLinks.description: links that can be used for further navigation, especially in REDIRECT approach

consentApproval.description: URL to be used by the PISP in order to start the ASPSP authentication and operation confirmation process

AppliedAuthenticationApproach.description: The ASPSP, based on the authentication approaches proposed by the PISP, choose the one that it can processed, in respect with the preferences and constraints of the PSU and indicates in this field which approach has been chosen

GenericOrganisationIdentification.description:
ISO20022: Unique identification of an organisation, as assigned by an issuer.
API: The ASPSP will document which account reference type it will support.

schemeName.description:
Name of the identification scheme.
Possible values for the scheme name, partially based on ISO20022 external code list, are the following:
- BANK (BankPartyIdentification): Unique and unambiguous assignment made by a specific bank or similar financial institution to identify a relationship as defined between the bank and its client.
- COID (CountryIdentificationCode) : Country authority given organisation identification (e.g., corporate registration number)
- SREN (SIREN): The SIREN number is a 9 digit code assigned by INSEE, the French National Institute for Statistics and Economic Studies, to identify an organisation in France.
- SRET (SIRET): The SIRET number is a 14 digit code assigned by INSEE, the French National Institute for Statistics and Economic Studies, to identify an organisation unit in France. It consists of the SIREN number, followed by a five digit classification number, to identify the local geographical unit of that entity.
Each implementation of the STET PSD2 API must specify in its own documentation which schemes can actually been used

issuer.description: ISO20022: Entity that assigns the identification. this could a country code or any organisation name or identifier that can be recognized by both parties

GenericPrivateIdentification.description:
ISO20022: Unique identification of a person, as assigned by an issuer.
API: The ASPSP will document which account reference type it will support.

schemeName.description:
Name of the identification scheme.
Possible values for the scheme name, partially based on ISO20022 external code list, are the following:
- BANK (BankPartyIdentification): Unique and unambiguous assignment made by a specific bank or similar financial institution to identify a relationship as defined between the bank and its client.
- NIDN (NationalIdentityNumber): Number assigned by an authority to identify the national identity number of a person.

issuer.description: ISO20022: Entity that assigns the identification. this could a country code or any organisation name or identifier that can be recognized by both parties

PsuPrivateIdentification.description: ISO20022: Unique identification of a PSU, as assigned by the ASPSP.

PsuPrivateIdentificationSchemeName.description:
Name of the identification scheme.

The only currently supported value for the scheme name is:

  - OAUT (OAUTH2): OAUTH2 access token that is owned by the PISP being
also an AISP and that can be used in order to identify the PSU

PsuAccountIdentification.description: Unique account identification for a PSU who is a customer of the ASPSP.

iban.description:
ISO20022: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) - identification used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer.

Further specifications of the format and content of the IBAN can be found in the standard ISO 13616 "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)" version 1997-10-01, or later revisions.

AccountIdentification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification for the account between the account owner and the account servicer.

iban.description:
ISO20022: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) - identification used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer.

Further specifications of the format and content of the IBAN can be found in the standard ISO 13616 "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)" version 1997-10-01, or later revisions.

BeneficiaryAccountIdentification.description:
Unique and unambiguous identification for the account between the beneficiary and the account servicer.
For SEPA and countries where IBAN is supported, an IBAN must be used to identify the beneficiary account. For countries where IBAN is not supported, banking account identifiers with scheme `BANK` must be used.

iban.description:
ISO20022: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) - identification used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer.

Further specifications of the format and content of the IBAN can be found in the standard ISO 13616 "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)" version 1997-10-01, or later revisions.

BeneficiaryOtherAccountIdentification.description: Identification for a beneficiary account that cannot be identified by an IBAN. This object only supports the BANK scheme, that is, the account reference as known by the beneficiary's bank.

schemeName.description:
Name of the account identification scheme.
For CIC, the only supported scheme is `BANK`, to designate a bank-specific account identifier.

CurrencyCode.description:
Specifies the currency of the amount or of the account.
A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".

AmountType.description: Structure aiming to embed the amount and the currency to be used.

amount.description: ISO20022: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.

ClearingSystemMemberIdentification.description:
ISO20022: Information used to identify a member within a clearing system.
API: to be used for some specific international credit transfers in order to identify the beneficiary bank

clearingSystemId.description: ISO20022: Specification of a pre-agreed offering between clearing agents or the channel through which the payment instruction is processed.

memberId.description: ISO20022: Identification of a member of a clearing system.

FinancialInstitutionIdentification.description: ISO20022: Unique and unambiguous identification of a financial institution, as assigned under an internationally recognised or proprietary identification scheme.

bicFi.description: ISO20022: Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362 "Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identification code (BIC)".

PostalAddress.description: ISO20022 : Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services.

country.description: ISO20022: Country in which a person resides (the place of a person's home). In the case of a company, it is the country from which the affairs of that company are directed.

addressLine.description:
Unstructured address.
For SEPA payments, only two address lines are allowed.
The city is in the second line.

PsuIdentification.description: API : Description of a Party which can be either a person or an organization, who is identified as the PSU, registered by the ASPSP.

name.description: ISO20022: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party.

privateId.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of an ASPSP PSU.

PartyIdentification.description: API : Description of a Party which can be either a person or an organization.

name.description: ISO20022: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party.

organisationId.description: Unique and unambiguous way to identify an organisation.

privateId.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a person.

ResourceId.description: API: Identifier assigned by the ASPSP for further use of the created resource through API calls

PaymentIdentification.description: ISO20022: Set of elements used to reference a payment instruction.

instructionId.description:
ISO20022: Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction.

API: Unique identification shared between the PISP and the ASPSP

endToEndId.description: ISO20022: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

PriorityCode.description:
ISO20022: Indicator of the urgency or order of importance that the instructing party would like the instructed party to apply to the processing of the instruction.
API: This field is useless for SCTInst and thus should be ignored.

CategoryPurposeCode.description:
ISO20022: Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction based on a
set of pre-defined categories. This is used by the initiating party to
provide information concerning the processing of the payment. It is
likely to trigger special processing by any of the agents involved in
the payment chain.

API: The following values are allowed:

| Code | Name | Description |
| ---- | ---- | ---------- |
| CASH | CashManagementTransfer | Transaction is a general cash management instruction. |
| DVPM | DeliverAgainstPayment | Code used to pre-advise the account servicer of a forthcoming deliver against payment instruction. |

ServiceLevelCode.description:
ISO20022: Agreement under which or rules under which the transaction should be processed. Specifies a pre-agreed service or level of service between the parties, as published in an external service level code list.
API: Only "SEPA" (SEPA Credit Transfer) value is allowed. In order to initiate a cross-border payment outside of SEPA, this field must not be set. Attempting to initiate a payment in the SEPA area without setting the "SEPA" service level will be rejected with an HTTP 400 error.

LocalInstrumentCode.description:
ISO20022: User community specific instrument.
Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level.
API: "INST" value is to be used in order to ask for an SEPA instant Payment (SCTInst).
For International payments, this field may be valued with one of the ISO20022 external code to specify with payment instrument should be used by the creditor's bank.

PaymentTypeInformation.description: ISO20022: Set of elements used to further specify the type of transaction.

PurposeCode.description:
ISO20022: Underlying reason for the payment transaction, as published in
an external purpose code list.

API: The following values are allowed for Payment  Request

| Code | Name | Description |
| ---- | ---- | ---------- |
| ACCT | AccountManagement | Funds moved between 2 accounts of same account holder at the same bank |
| CASH | CashManagementTransfer | (general cash management instruction) may be used for Transfer Initiation |
| COMC | CommercialPayment | Transaction is related to a payment of commercial credit or debit. |
| CPKC | CarparkCharges | General Carpark Charges Transaction is related to carpark charges. |
| TRPT | RoadPricing | Transport RoadPricing Transaction is for the payment to top-up pre-paid card and electronic road pricing for the purpose of transportation. |

ChargeBearerCode.description:
ISO20022: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated
with the processing of the payment transaction.

The following values are allowed:

| Code | Name | Description |
| ---- | ---- | ---------- |
| SLEV | FollowingServiceLevel | Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme. |

RemittanceInformation.description: ISO20022: Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system.

items.title: remittanceLine
items.pattern: ^[-a-zA-Z0-9 รฉรชรซรงรขรนรปรดรฎ.,;:/!?$%_=+()*ยฐ@รรรรรรรรร]{0,35}$

CreditTransferRemittanceInformation.description:
ISO20022: Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system.
Combining structured and unstructured information is not supported for CIC.

items.title: remittanceLine
items.pattern: ^[-a-zA-Z0-9 รฉรชรซรงรขรนรปรดรฎ.,;:/!?$%_=+()*ยฐ@รรรรรรรรร]{0,140}$

PaymentInformationStatusCode.description: ISO20022: Specifies the status of the payment information. API: Mandatory. The following values are allowed to provide the status of the Payment Request | Code | Name | Description | | ---- | ---- | ---------- | | ACCP | AcceptedCustomerProfile | Preceding check of technical validation was successful. Customer profile check was also successful. | | ACSC | AcceptedSettlementCompleted | Settlement on the debtor's account has been completed. | | ACSP | AcceptedSettlementInProcess | All preceding checks such as technical validation and customer profile were successful. Dynamic risk assessment is now also successful and therefore the Payment Request has been accepted for execution. | | ACTC | AcceptedTechnicalValidation | Authentication and syntactical and semantical validation are successful. | | ACWC | AcceptedWithChange | Instruction is accepted but a change will be made, such as date or remittance not sent. | | ACWP | AcceptedWithoutPosting | Payment instruction included in the credit transfer is accepted without being posted to the creditor customerโs account. | | CANC | Cancelled | Payment initiation has been successfully cancelled after having received a request for cancellation. | | PART | PartiallyAccepted | A number of transactions have been accepted, whereas another number of transactions have not yet achieved 'accepted' status. | | PATC | PartiallyAcceptedTechnicalCorrect | Payment initiation needs multiple authentications, where some but not yet all have been performed. Syntactical and semantical validations are successful. | | RCVD | Received | Payment initiation has been received by the receiving agent. | | PDNG | Pending | Payment request or individual transaction included in the Payment Request is pending. Further checks and status update will be performed. | | RJCT | Rejected | Payment request has been rejected. |

TransactionIndividualStatusCode.description: ISO20022: Specifies the status of the payment information group. API: Only the following values are allowed to provide the status of the subsequent CREDIT TRANSFER to the Payment Request | Code | Name | Description | | ---- | ---- | ---------- | | ACSC | AcceptedSettlementCompleted | Settlement on the debtor's account has been completed. | | ACSP | AcceptedSettlementInProcess | All preceding checks such as technical validation and customer profile were successful and therefore the Payment Request has been accepted for execution. | | ACTC | AcceptedTechnicalValidation | Authentication and syntactical and semantical validation are successful. | | CANC | Cancelled | Payment initiation has been successfully cancelled after having received a request for cancellation. | | PDNG | Pending | Payment request or individual transaction included in the Payment Request is pending. Further checks and status update will be performed. | | RJCT | Rejected | Payment request or individual transaction included in the Payment Request has been rejected. |

StatusReasonInformation.description:
ISO20022: Provides detailed information on the status reason.

API: Can only be used in case the status is equal to `RJCT` or `CANC`. Only the following values are allowed:
| Code | Name | Description |
| ---- | ---- | ---------- |
| AC01 | IncorectAccountNumber | the account number is either invalid or does not exist
| AC04 | ClosedAccountNumber | the account is closed and cannot be used
| AC06 | BlockedAccount | the account is blocked and cannot be used
| AG01 | Transaction forbidden | Transaction forbidden on this type of account
| AM18 | InvalidNumberOfTransactions | the number of transactions exceeds the ASPSP acceptance limit
| CH03 | RequestedExecutionDateOrRequestedCollectionDateTooFarInFuture | The requested execution date is too far in the future
| CUST | RequestedByCustomer | The reject is due to the debtor: refusal or lack of liquidity
| DS02 | OrderCancelled | An authorized user has cancelled the order
| DUPL | DuplicatePayment | Payment is a duplicate of another payment. Can only be set by a PISP for a payment request cancellation.
| FF01 | InvalidFileFormat | The reject is due to the original Payment Request which is invalid (syntax, structure or values)
| FRAD | FraudulentOriginated | the Payment Request is considered as fraudulent
| MS03 | NotSpecifiedReasonAgentGenerated | No reason specified by the ASPSP
| NOAS | NoAnswerFromCustomer | The PSU has neither accepted nor rejected the Payment Request and a time-out has occurred
| RR01 | MissingDebtorAccountOrIdentification | The Debtor account and/or Identification are missing or inconsistent
| RR03 | MissingCreditorNameOrAddress | Specification of the creditorโs name and/or address needed for regulatory requirements is insufficient or missing.
| RR04 | RegulatoryReason | Reject from regulatory reason
| RR12 | InvalidPartyID | Invalid or missing identification required within a particular country or payment type.
| TECH | TechnicalProblem | Technical problems resulting in an erroneous transaction. Can only be set by a PISP for a payment request cancellation.

RegulatoryReportingCode.description:
Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.
Economical codes to be used are provided by the National Competent Authority

RegulatoryReportingCodes.description:
List of needed regulatory reporting codes for international payments.
For a request to the Emirates the code is specified by Central Bank of UAE.
In other case, for example in the case of a signifiant amount, a code defined by national agency can be required.

RequestedExecutionDate.description:
ISO20022: Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment.
API:
This field indicates the date at which the debtor account should be debited.
In most of the cases, especially for international payments, the date of the credit on the credit account cannot be set. Only SCTInst can guarantee having the same date for this credit.
This date can be used in the following cases:
- the single requested execution date for a payment having several instructions. In this case, this field must be set at the payment level.
- the requested execution date for a given instruction within a payment. In this case, this field must be set at each instruction level.
- The first date of execution for a standing order.
When the payment cannot be processed at this date, the ASPSP is allowed to shift the applied execution date to the next possible execution date for non-standing orders.
For standing orders, the [executionRule] parameter helps to compute the execution date to be applied.

EndDate.description:
The last applicable day of execution for a given standing order.
If not given, the standing order is considered as endless.

ExecutionRule.description:
Execution date shifting rule for standing orders

This data attribute defines the behaviour when recurring payment dates
falls on a weekend or bank holiday.

The payment is then executed either the "preceding" or "following"
working day.

ASPSP might reject the request due to the communicated value, if rules
in Online-Banking are not supporting this execution rule.

| Code | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| FWNG | following |
| PREC | preceding |

FrequencyCode.description:
Frequency rule for standing orders.

The following codes from the "EventFrequency7Code" of ISO 20022 are
supported.

| Code | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| MNTH | Monthly |
| TOMN | EveryTwoMonths |
| QUTR | Quarterly |
| SEMI | SemiAnnual |
| YEAR | Annual |

CreditTransferTransaction.description:
ISO20022: Payment processes required to transfer cash from the debtor to the creditor.
API:

SupplementaryData.description:
ISO20022: Additional information that cannot be captured in the structured elements and/or any other specific block.

API: This structure is used to embed the relevant URLs for returning the status report to the PISP and to specify which authentication approaches are accepted by the PISP and which has been chosen by the ASPSP

acceptedAuthenticationApproach.description:
can only be set by the PISP
authentication approaches that are supported by the PISP. The PISP can provide several choices separated by commas.
REDIRECT: the PSU is redirected by the TPP to the ASPSP which processes identification and authentication
Implementation notes: Any PISP that contacts this implementation must support the REDIRECT authentication approach in order for authentication to be successful.

items.description: combination of possible values for authentication approaches

scaHint.description:
can only be set by the PISP
Hint given by the merchant and/or the PISP about an SCA exemption context

successfulReportUrl.description: This parameter is not used anymore. Redirection now works as in OAuth 2 authorization code flow. The redirection URI must be provided by the PISP in the provided authorization URL.

unsuccessfulReportUrl.description: This parameter is not used anymore. Redirection now works as in OAuth 2 authorization code flow. The redirection URI must be provided by the PISP in the provided authorization URL.

BalanceStatus.description:
Type of balance
| Code | Name | Description |
| ---- | ---- | ----------- |
| CLBD | ISO20022 ClosingBooked | Accounting Balance |
| XPCD | ISO20022 Expected | Instant Balance |
| VALU | | Value-date balance |
| OTHR | | Other Balance. This balance type is used for balance objects related to a set of card-based transactions that will be booked at the same date. |

TransactionStatus.description:
Type of Transaction
| Code | Name | Description |
| ---- | ---- | ----------- |
| BOOK | ISO20022 ClosingBooked | Booked transaction |
| PDNG | ISO20022 Pending | Transaction that is expected to be booked and already affects the instant balance |
| OTHR | Other | Transaction that is not booked and does not affect the instant balance |

CreditDebitIndicator.description:
Accounting flow of the amount
- CRDT: Credit type amount
- DBIT: Debit type amount

Transaction.description:
Structure of a transactions.
At least `expectedBookingDate` or `bookingDate` must be set.

bookingDate.description: Booking date of the transaction on the account

expectedBookingDate.description: Expected booking date of a transaction that is not yet booked.

valueDate.description: Value date of the transaction on the account

transactionDate.description:
Date used for specific purposes:
- for card transaction: date of the transaction
- for credit transfer: acquiring date of the transaction
- for direct debit: receiving date of the transaction

PsuStatusType.description:
ISO20022: Specifies the type of account ownership.
| Name | Description |
| ---- | ---------- |
| Account Holder | Person which is the sole holder of the account. |
| Account Co-Holder | Person which shares with others the holding of the account. |
| Attorney | Generic case of a person having a mandate to access the account data. |

AccountResource.description: PSU account that is made available to the TPP

name.description:
Label of the PSU account
For sets of card-based transaction sets, that name also specifies the holder name. Imputation dates can be found on balance objects.

linkedAccount.description: Case of a set of pending card transactions, the APSP will provide the relevant cash account the card is set up on.

cashAccountType.description:
Specifies the type of the account
- CACC: Cash account
- CARD: List of card based transactions

balances.description: list of balances provided by the ASPSP

example.name: 33022 295696077 13 COMPTE DE MR ET MME DUPONT

lastChangeDateTime.description: Timestamp of the last change of the balance amount

referenceDate.description:
Reference date for the balance.

For a balance related to a set of card-based transactions that
all have the same booking date, the reference date of the balance
will be set to that expected booking date.

Nonce.description: Challenge to be sent in order to avoid replay of the authentication process.

EmptyConfirmationResource.description: Empty confirmation request resource, for OAuth 2 `REDIRECT` workflows.

NonceConfirmationResource.description: Confirmation request resource with a nonce, for `NONE` authentication workflows.

PaymentInformationId.description: ISO20022 : Reference assigned by a sending party to unambiguously identify the payment information block within the message.

CreationDateTime.description: ISO20022: Date and time at which a (group of) payment instruction(s) was created by the instructing party.

FundsAvailabilityInformation.description:
Indicates whether the payment can be covered by the funds available
on the relevant account:
- true: payment can be covered
- false: payment cannot be covered

BookingInformation.description:
Indicates whether the payment can be immediately booked or not
- true: payment can be booked
- false: payment cannot be booked

Booking a transaction means that the funds required by this transaction are immediatly reserved and that a subsequent transaction will not interfere with the proper execution of the payment. 
However, usual fraud detection mechanisms might still be triggered and result as a rejection of the payment.
This indicator must be provided when the relevant Credit Transfer will be executed as soon as possible but not as an instant payment.
This indicator is irrelevant and will not be provided for delayed payments.
This indicator is only relevant for the first occurrence of a standing order when this occurrence is not delayed and will be executed as soon as possible.

In case the Information System cannot handle immediate booking, CIC will provide funds availability information.

BatchBookingIndicator.description:
Indicates whether a single entry per individual transaction or a batch entry for the sum of the amounts of all transactions within the group of a message is requested.
Meaning When True: Identifies that a batch entry for the sum of the amounts of all transactions in the batch or message is requested.
Meaning When False: Identifies that a single entry for each of the transactions in the batch or message is requested.

Implementation note for CIC: Only `false` is supported.

PaymentRequestResource.description:
ISO20022: The PaymentRequestResource message is sent by the Creditor sending party to the Debtor receiving party, directly or through agents. It is used by a Creditor to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor.
API:
Information about the creditor (Id, account and agent) might be placed either at payment level or at instruction level. Thus multi-beneficiary payments can be handled.
The requested execution date can be placed either at payment level when all instructions are requested to be executed at the same date or at instruction level.
The latest case includes:
- multiple instructions having different requested execution dates
- standing orders settings
Payment without type information is non-SEPA and can not contain transaction to SEPA country.

numberOfTransactions.description:
ISO20022: Number of individual transactions contained in the message.
API: Each ASPSP will specify a maximum value for this field taking into accounts its specificities about payment request handling

acceptDebtorAccountChange.description:
Indicates whether the TPP would accept a change to the debtor account by the ASPSP if needed
- true: debtor account can be changed (default value)
- false: debtor account cannot be changed

acceptChargeHandlingChange.description:
Indicates whether charge handling can be changed by the ASPSP if needed
- true: charge handling can be changed (default value)
- false: charge handling cannot be changed

ultimateCreditor.description:
This field exists only for v1.0/v1.1-initiated payment requests.
It is replaced by a field at CreditTransferTransaction-level.

It follows the `PartyIdentification` schema (like initiatingParty).

purpose.description:
This field exists only for v1.0/v1.1-initiated payment requests.
It is replaced by a field at CreditTransferTransaction-level.

It follows the `PurposeCode` schema.

requestedExecutionDate.description: ISO20022: Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment.

creditTransferTransaction.description:
ISO20022: Payment processes required to transfer cash from the debtor to the creditor.
API: Each ASPSP will specify a maxItems value for this field taking into accounts its specificities about payment request handling

PaymentCoverageRequestResource.description: Payment coverage request structure. The request must rely either on a cash account or a payment card.

paymentCoverageRequestId.description: Identification of the payment Coverage Request

payee.description: The merchant where the card is accepted as information to the PSU.

HalAccounts.description: HYPERMEDIA structure used for returning the list of the available accounts to the AISP

accounts.description: List of PSU account that are made available to the TPP

accounts.name: 33022 295696077 13 COMPTE DE MR ET MME DUPONT

HalBalances.description: HYPERMEDIA structure used for returning the list of the relevant balances for a given account to the AISP

HalTransactions.description: HYPERMEDIA structure used for returning the list of the transactions for a given account to the AISP

HalPaymentRequest.description: HYPERMEDIA structure used for returning the original Payment Request to the PISP

HalPaymentRequestCreation.description: Data sent by the ASPSP to the PISP after creation of the Payment Request resource

appliedAuthenticationApproach.description: The applied authentication approach for confirmation. Will always be `REDIRECT`.

HalPaymentRequestCancellation.description: Data sent by the ASPSP to the PISP in response to a valid cancellation request.

appliedAuthenticationApproach.description: The applied authentication approach for cancellation. Will always be `NONE`.

HalPaymentCoverageReport.description: HYPERMEDIA structure used for returning the payment coverage report to the CBPII

result.description:
Result of the coverage check :
- true: the payment can be covered
- false: the payment cannot be covered

isTrusted.description:
Indicates whether the beneficiary has been registered
by the PSU within the trusted beneficiaries list.

When that information is returned by the ASPSP on the
`GET /trusted-beneficiaries/`, then it indicates that the
beneficiary is actually on the list of trusted beneficiaries.

When that information is sent by a PISP on the
`POST /payment-requests/`, it indicates the status that is
expected by the PISP to be the case, e.g. in the case of a
TPP with both AISP and PISP qualities, using the result from
a previous call to `GET /trusted-beneficiaries` for that PSU.

HalEndUserIdentity.description: HYPERMEDIA structure used for returning the identity of the PSU

connectedPsu.description:
Last name and first name that has granted access to the AISP on the accounts data
This information can be retrieved based on the PSU's authentication that occurred during the OAUTH2 access token initialisation.

HalBeneficiaries.description: HYPERMEDIA structure used for returning the list of the whitelisted beneficiaries
